title: Historical Stock Splits and Corporate Actions of Avantor Inc

content.text: Avantor Inc goes public and begins trading on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) under the ticker symbol 'AVTR'. At this point, there have been no stock splits or significant corporate actions.

Avantor Inc announces a 1-for-2 reverse stock split. This means that for every two shares owned, investors will receive one share. The purpose of this reverse stock split is to increase the share price and potentially attract institutional investors.
The reverse stock split becomes effective. The number of outstanding shares reduces proportionately, and the share price increases accordingly.

Avantor Inc announces a 2-for-1 stock split. This means that for every one share owned, shareholders will receive an additional share. The purpose of this stock split is to decrease the share price and potentially increase liquidity.
The stock split becomes effective, and the number of outstanding shares doubles. The share price adjusts accordingly to reflect the split.

Avantor Inc has experienced one reverse stock split and one stock split in its history since going public. The reverse stock split occurred in October 2019, while the stock split occurred in June 2021.
The reverse stock split aimed to increase the share price, potentially attracting institutional investors. On the other hand, the stock split aimed to decrease the share price and increase liquidity.
The analysis only considers significant stock splits and corporate actions and may not include minor events or changes.
